title: The Plots Against Hitler
description:
The Plots Against Hitler - Danny Orbach [epub]

In 1933, Adolf Hitler became Chancellor of Germany. A year later, all parties but the Nazis had been outlawed, freedom of the press was but a memory, and Hitlerâ€™s dominance seemed complete. Yet over the next few years, an unlikely clutch of conspirators emerged â€“ soldiers, schoolteachers, politicians, diplomats, theologians, even a carpenter â€“ who would try repeatedly to end the FÃ¼hrerâ€™s reign. 

This dramatic and deeply researched book tells the full story of those doomed efforts. This is history at its most suspenseful, as we witness secret midnight meetings, crises of conscience, fierce debates among old friends about whether and how to dismantle Nazism, and the various plots themselves being devised and executed.
 
Orbachâ€™s fresh research takes advantage of his singular skills as linguist and historian to offer profound insight into the conspiratorsâ€™ methods, motivations, fears, and hopes. Though we know how this story ends, weâ€™ve had no idea until now how close it came â€“ several times â€“ to ending very differently
